content.webTitle: And for when you're fed up playing I-spy...

fields.headline: And for when you're fed up playing I-spy...
fields.bodyText: Art of the possible - quiet kids Kids don't need to be budding Picassos to enjoy this portable drawing desk, above, which comes with straps to attach it to the back seat of the car. The nylon casing opens up to form a hard base to lean on. Inside there are plenty of wax crayons, colouring pencils, fibre-tip pens and a notepad, perfect for everything from a bit of artwork to a game of hangman. The Art on the Move activity centre costs £14.99 from Tridias (0870 443 1300). Sound of silence Fed up with fights in the car over whether to listen to Justin Timberlake or Mozart? Solve the problem and keep the family entranced on the road with BBC Audiobooks, which has nine new tapes for this summer, including The Princess Diaries Take Two (£13.99) and Just William (£19.99). Don't worry if you've a long journey ahead of you - at nine hours, The Thief Lord (£19.99) will last the length of most trips. Available in most book shops or from the BBC on 0800 136919. Snack in the back Keep juice and nibbles in control but within easy reach of little hands in this car snack tray. Made from sturdy plastic, the tray hooks on to the car door. It may not stop the trail of crisps and cookie crumbs over the car but it should stop the wails of 'I've lost my packet of sweeties.' It costs £4.99 at Jojo Maman Bébé (0870 241 0560). Can you trump it? Remember Top Trumps? The game of collectable cards for two or more is making a comeback. The packs have moved on a bit from the traditional car theme, and now feature everything from dinosaurs to The Simpsons. Invest in a pack for £2.99 with www.firebox.com to guarantee some peace and quiet from the back seat.
